name: World Wide Technology
overview: World Wide Technology, Inc., a systems integrator, provides information technology and supply chain solutions to the commercial, government, and telecom sectors. It engages in reselling technology products and services. The company also offers supply chain management and asset recovery solutions. In addition, it offers network planning and design, equipment aggregation and staging, hardware configuration, software imaging, asset tagging, auditing, implementation, training, consulting, leasing, and managed services. The company serves commercial, federal, state and local, education, telecommunications, healthcare, and financial markets. World Wide Technology has strategic partnerships with Cisco Systems, Sun Microsystems, Hewlett Packard, EMC, Dell Computer Corporation, Novell, Computer Associates, Fujitsu, Tellabs, Microsoft, ADC, American Power Conversion (APC), Lexmark, Oracle, Symantec, Gateway Computer Corporation, IBM, Lenovo, Lucent, Alcatel, FileNET, Hitachi, Network Appliance, Sony Electronics, Network Technologies, Inc., and Iomega. The company was founded in 1990 and is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri. It has sales offices in Anchorage, Alaska; Atlanta, Georgia; Colorado Springs, Colorado; Lanham, Maryland; Kansas City, Missouri; McLean, Virginia; New York, New York; Salt Lake City, Utah; and Seattle, Washington. The company has distribution centers in St. Louis, Missouri Granite City, Illinois; Plano, Austin, and San Antonio, Texas; Livermore, California; Nashville, Tennessee; Reno, Nevada; Redmond, Washington; Phoenix, Arizona; High Point, North Carolina; West Chester, Ohio; and South Korea. World Wide Technology, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of World Wide Technology Holding Co., Inc.

acquisitions.source_description: World Wide Technology Acquires Performance Technology Group
